```{r}

       aes(x=y)) +

  filter(y < 3 | y > 20)|>
  select(price, x, y, z)|>
  arrange(y)
unusual
```

Replace unusual values with NA, do not drop them.

```{r}
diamonds2 <- diamonds|>
  mutate(y = if_else(y < 3 | y > 20, NA, y))
```

```{r}
ggplot(diamonds2,
       aes(x=x, y=y)) +
  geom_point()
```

```{r}
nycflights13::flights|>
  mutate(
    cancelled = is.na(dep_time),
    sched_hour = sched_dep_time %/% 100,
```

11.5 Covariation
https://r4ds.hadley.nz/eda#covariation

```{r}
ggplot(diamonds,
       aes(x = price)) +
  geom_freqpoly(aes(color = cut), binwidth = 500, linewidth = 0.75)
```

To make the comparison easier we need to swap what is displayed on the y-axis. Instead of displaying count, weâ€™ll display the density, which is the count standardized so that the area under each frequency polygon is one.

```{r}
ggplot(diamonds,
       aes(x = price, y = after_stat(density))) +
  geom_freqpoly(aes(color = cut), binwidth = 500, linewidth = 0.75)
```

```{r}
ggplot(diamonds,
       aes(x = cut, y = price)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  coord_flip()
```

Models

```{r}
diamonds <- diamonds|>
  mutate(
    log_price = log(price),
    log_carat = log(carat)
  )

diamonds_fit <- linear_reg() |>
  fit(log_price ~ log_carat, data = diamonds)

diamonds_aug <- augment(diamonds_fit, new_data = diamonds)|>
  mutate(.resid = exp(.resid))

ggplot(diamonds_aug, aes(x = carat, y = .resid)) +
  geom_point()
```

```{r}
ggplot(diamonds_aug,
       aes(x = cut, y = .resid)) +
  geom_boxplot()
```
